news.title: We hosted a group of artists together in Miami during Art Basel to discuss the state of NFTs. Here‚Äôs what we learned.
news.subtitle: 22 artists gathered at MetaMask‚Äôs inaugural Artist Potluck for an unforgettable evening.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
As the sun set one evening in bustling Miami during Art Basel week, some of web3‚Äôs most influential and talented NFT artists gathered at El Tuc√°n restaurant for MetaMask‚Äôs inaugural Artist Potluck.

The theme for the night was ‚ÄúConstellation‚Äù as MetaMask brought some of the brightest stars in the NFT space together for connection, camaraderie, and creativity. The atmosphere was filled with excitement and anticipation, as the artists enjoyed delicious food, drinks, and dialogue.

This was no ordinary potluck. Instead of bringing a dish to share, each artist came to the table with an NFT gift for one another. NFTs were minted on Manifold. By the end of the night, every artist left with a unique piece of art they could view in their MetaMask account, just in time for the giving season. Take a look at the stunning Constellation collection here: https://opensea.io/collection/constellation-artist-potluck

A prominent artist herself, and our very own community builder, Faith Love was all smiles as she hosted and greeted the ecstatic creators. If you get a chance, ask her about the tablecloth, we heard it was her favorite piece of the night. üòâ

Joe Lubin, Co-Founder of Ethereum and CEO of ConsenSys kicked off the festivities with a toast to the creators.

Besides spoiling the artists with a decadent dinner replete with black truffle pizzetta, sushi platters, woodfired wagyu beef tomahawk, and so much more (they were surprised each time a new course was served), drinks and entertainment were ever-flowing. We even had a designer, Tara Moves, sketch the event in real-time:

Chatting with the artists

We could rave on about the night but you don‚Äôt have to take our word for it. We had the pleasure of interviewing some of the creators in attendance: Bryan Brinkman, Stonez, Kira Bursky, Ant Pantone, Aaron Ricketts, and Angel. It was refreshing to hear their thoughts about art, technology, community, and the future of NFTs.

They all chose to become NFT artists for a variety of reasons, including the potential for royalties and perpetual income, the ability to connect with other artists, and the desire for more control and freedom in their work.

‚ÄúFor artists, it‚Äôs a whole new revenue stream that‚Äôs emerged. I have friends through Twitter that are artists who were previously not working full time that are now because of the NFTs,‚Äù said Kira Bursky, a filmmaker and multidisciplinary artist.

Many of them cited the potential for NFTs to allow them to support themselves through their art and invest in other artists' creative journeys. Overall, the decision to become an NFT artist seems to be driven by a combination of financial and artistic considerations.

Bryan Brinkman is a digital artist that specializes in animation and cartoon art. ‚ÄúTo me, NFT offers a closer connection to the artist. When you collect a piece of art from Art Basel you might not have a personal connection with that artist, you might have bought it from a gallery. With NFTs, you‚Äôre able to talk directly to the artist, have a connection, and be invested in their journey and growth. You can watch them flourish in this space, which you can do with traditional art to an extent, but it‚Äôs not as easy to do on a massive scale like it is with NFTs‚Ä¶. Connecting with this community is the most fun part of this space.‚Äù

While artist Aaron Ricketts‚Äî photographer, visual artist, and self-proclaimed realistic surrealist‚Äîsaid, ‚ÄúEverything about [NFTs] is exciting. Whether it‚Äôs photographers, painters, music artists, people are taking more control over what they create and what they put out into the world. Cutting out the middleman and making it about the art again. That‚Äôs important because artists now are shining in ways they may not have.‚Äù

It hit closer to home for Stonez, a musician and digital artist who addressed the key reasons that drew him to the space: being able to protect yourself as an artist, having your family be able to reap the benefits of your art, and how the blockchain protects that.

‚ÄúIn a traditional art world there are too many instances where an artist doesn‚Äôt get their recognition till after they die, but also their family isn‚Äôt able to reap the benefits of that because there's no trace, but on-chain‚Äîwith splits and royalties‚Äîyour family can [benefit] forever [from] your creations.‚Äù

Besides MetaMask being their favorite wallet, it was interesting to observe how these artists shared a similar sentiment when it came to their favorite part about minting an NFT‚Äîthe excitement, joy of sharing it with the world, and the ensuing butterflies once live.

Their favorite part about owning an NFT was supporting other artists‚Äîfriends and internet strangers alike‚Äîand they quickly declared how rewarding it is to cheer on other creators as a buyer: to invest in their growth and watch them flourish. As Bryan Brinkman put it, ‚ÄúConnecting with this community is the most fun part of this space.‚Äù

Much of the creative process involves being in the flow, or ‚Äúin the zone,‚Äù a mental state in which a person is fully immersed and focused on the action of making art. When asked about his creative process, Aaron Ricketts, explained it‚Äôs more about just living in the flow and reaching his nirvana in the day-to-day. Instead of forcing it, Aaron places an emphasis on observing the world.

‚ÄúPart of that is practicing abundance mentality and understanding things are okay even when they may not be okay. Understanding when it comes to creativity and doing things, it‚Äôs not really something you have to do. It's something that happens and naturally occurs.‚Äù

Kira Bursky felt similar when she noted, ‚ÄúEverything I create is very subconscious and I let it happen. I'm along for the ride. I don‚Äôt know where it‚Äôs going to take me, but it generally stems from some core feeling in my body, a sensation, and I just see what metaphor is going to play out from that visually.‚Äù

The group of artists was very diverse with music, canvas, digital, motion, and poetry as their respective mediums, having something to say to the world, and themselves.

With Angel‚Äôs art, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs telling people to be happy,‚Äù stemming from her own personal struggles with mental health.

True ownership and the future of NFTs

It sometimes feels like NFT artists are overlooked when it comes to the ‚Äútech side‚Äù of crypto, but more often than not, they are deep proponents of core web3 principles like true ownership and security. Artists, more than degen traders, seem to realize the importance of self-custody.

When Ant Pantone‚Äîan artist with both analog and digital approaches‚Äîwas asked about this, he didn‚Äôt hesitate to repeat the mantra, not your keys, not your coins.

‚ÄúMetaMask gives me the financial independence that I need. I don‚Äôt need to be run by a bank. I own my keys. I love [MetaMask] security and communication.‚Äù

A strong preference for self-custody is a sentiment we feel will be adopted by more people. This is the silver lining during the recent insolvency of big CeFi players: more people are asking important questions and taking a closer look at the security of their assets to make informed decisions.

Where does one start with their self-custody journey? Education. Whether you‚Äôre an artist, DeFi dabbler, or tech veteran‚Äîyou can download MetaMask, the wallet that gives you the freedom to exit anytime, for any reason.

We closed our conversations out on a fun note, asking each artist to describe the future of NFTs in three words:

MetaMask‚Äôs inaugural Artist Potluck in Miami hearkened back to ages of old when brilliant minds would come together over dinner and drinks, and talk about their art and what inspires them. Only this time, the medium was enhanced with blockchain technology.

Thank you to all the artists who showed up and continue sharing their creations with the world. This community wouldn‚Äôt be the same without you. Special thanks to Faith Love for hosting and curating such an electric evening. It was an unforgettable night, and we can‚Äôt wait to do it all again.

nodes.title: How to sell crypto
nodes.subtitle: Turn your crypto to cash. In a flash.

image.title: How to sell crypto with MetaMask
image.description: MetaMask makes selling cryptocurrencies fast, easy, and secure. With low fees and seamless off-ramping.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Selling crypto for cash is as simple as can be with MetaMask. You can exchange crypto from MetaMask wallet directly to your debit card, credit card, PayPal, or bank account. No unnecessary steps, no excess fees, no worries.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you sell cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you how to sell crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ü¶ä

How MetaMask empowers you

  • Sell directly from your MetaMask wallet, and send cash to the place that works for you.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Buy crypto, use crypto, and sell crypto. All in one place.

How MetaMask keeps you secure

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store ‚Äî nor do we have access to ‚Äî any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask gives you choice

  • Choose your preferred destination for your cash including: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, and PayPal.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Sell crypto using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

Sell crypto with MetaMask Extension

Click the Buy & Sell button on MetaMask extension to redirect to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Sell.
  3. Select your region, and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Enter the amount of crypto that you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  5. Select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  6. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs website where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask Portfolio once you accept the quote.
  7. Upon returning to MetaMask Portfolio click Send ETH.
  8. Click Confirm to complete the transaction in your MetaMask wallet.

Note: You can click on Sell to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Sell crypto with MetaMask app

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap on the menu button‚Äö which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Sell.
  4. Select your region and currency‚Äîthis is located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Enter the crypto amount you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  6. Tap Send your cash to and select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal. Availability will depend on your region.
  7. Tap Get quotes to proceed.
  8. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs portal, where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask app once you accept the quote.
  9. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and tap Confirm to complete the transaction.

Note: You can tap on progress notification to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to get started? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app in the Apple Store or Google Store.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

nodes.title: Transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available in MetaMask
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.

image.title: Centralized exchange transfers MetaMask now available
image.description: Centralized exchange transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available on MetaMask.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask Portfolio now supports centralized exchange (CEX) transfers from Coinbase and Binance, streamlining the process of transferring assets to your crypto wallet.

Many web3 users have digital assets divided across multiple wallets and accounts, creating a fragmented experience. Moving assets from one platform to another can be overly complicated and involve many steps‚Äîfraught with the risks of copying and pasting addresses incorrectly, and potential security concerns. MetaMask‚Äôs new CEX transfer feature is a solution to this issue, making your wallet more powerful, while also strengthening security.

Instant transfer of assets from centralized exchanges into your MetaMask wallet

MetaMask CEX transfers allow you to immediately move assets between accounts, eliminating the need for manually entering addresses. And, if you have bank accounts linked to your Coinbase or Binance accounts, purchasing crypto directly with your bank account to your MetaMask wallet has never been easier. No additional KYC necessary.

In April 2024, MetaMask partnered with Meld and Mesh to launch a feature that allowed users to track external CEX balances by linking Coinbase or Binance accounts directly from the MetaMask Portfolio dashboard. Now, you can view CEX balances, and also transfer assets from these exchanges into your MetaMask wallet. Neither MetaMask, nor our partners in this integration, will ever have access to your exchange login credentials, or share your wallet addresses with third parties.

CEX transfers will initially support Coinbase or Binance accounts, with expansion to additional exchanges on the horizon. No fees will be charged when transferring digital assets from exchanges to MetaMask. A nominal transaction fee of 0.25% will be applied when transferring from MetaMask to centralized exchanges. Network gas fees also apply.

By bridging the gap between self-custodial and centralized platforms, MetaMask is paving the way for a more powerful, integrated, and user-friendly DeFi ecosystem. Head to MetaMask Portfolio today to get started with CEX transfers.
